newsitem.title: UK: LPC - Israel to seek $200 mln syndicated loan.
newsitem.headline: LPC - Israel to seek $200 mln syndicated loan.

text.p: LONDON, September 5 (LPC) - The State of Israel has asked banks to prepare bids for a new syndicated loan of at least $200 million, according to bank sources.
A number of bidding groups are coalescing, bankers say, including British, American, German, Swiss and Israeli banks.

Banks are structuring loans of between $200 million and $250 million with final maturities of between five and seven years. Pricing on the credit should be about 30 bps over LIBOR, bankers say, with some more agressive bids with a margin closer to 25 bps.

In September 1995 Israel took a $100 million credit arranged by Bank Leumi, BZW and Chemical Bank. That deal had a four-year element priced 45 bps over LIBOR and a five-year element with a margin of 50 bps.
Though the likely sharp drop in pricing may partly be explained by an oversupply of funds in the loan market, Isreal's credit profile has also improved.
In December 1995 Standard & Poor's raised the State of Israel's long-term foreign currency debt rating to A minus, from BBB plus, citing the government's commitment to reducing its debt burden.
Israel also plans a $750 million note programme and a $200 million Eurobond in the fourth quarter, both to be led by Merrill Lynch.
